channel.title: Webclient Help
channel.description:
Hello,
Im currently trying to run a webclient on my site. Ive already signed the jarred file and have everything in order, but the webclient still wont load. It freezes at "downloading data" and then the screen goes black. Im following the easyrsc/rscd v25 webclient tutorial. The problem is that its not reading the data files. Im beyond frustrated with this and have no idea where to go from here. It would be great if someone who understands this could walk me through this process and see what i am doing wrong.
Cheers, Wife Beater

item.title: Webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

Is the webclient designed for EasyRSC? I think it probably will be. You’ll be using an EasyRSC Jar this is why it will not connect to a different type of server… I may be wrong.

Read full topic

Can u teamview me please?

@Wife_Beater wrote:

This is driving me nuts! I made sure all the packets arent mismatched but its still not working! Can someone Please teamview me when they have some time?

item.title: Webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Make sure that both the client and server read the packets the same way

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @Wife_Beater Wife Beater
item.description:
@Wife_Beater wrote:

imthenull:

Try making the client read the cache from a fixed location, rather than where it’s being executed

Ok I fixed the webclient so it loads all the way, however I can only get EasyRSC servers to actually connect to it. My main server (which uses a database) says unable to connect to server. However, on my server command prompt it says “Login from 127.0.0.1”, so it its reading that im connecting, but the webclient still says “Sorry! Unable to connect” Any ideas? I made sure all the ports/ips are correct and that the data is being fed to it properly

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Try making the client read the cache from a fixed location, rather than where it’s being executed

Read full topic
